abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Rijeka Gateway Project
            for Croatia were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            unsatisfactory, risk to development outcome was low or
            negligible, Bank performance was moderately satisfactory,
            and Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: unexpected events should be
            expected in a large-scale project. Whether a project is
            successful depends on how these events are addressed.
            Project complexity increases implementation risk. The
            technical challenges, the disparate elements and the reform
            agenda made this project nearly impossible to successfully
            implement. The results framework matters, and is how a
            project is evaluated. Legal changes might not be appropriate
            for specific investment loans. Institutional reform requires
            commitment from the government and built-in incentives from
            the project design. The capacity of the counterparts in
            contract management is essential in a large civil works
            project. Financial management and safeguards compliance
            capacity of the counterparts, the counterparts capacity to
            manage large civil works contracts is essential to the
            success of complex infrastructure projects.

repnme.cdata!: Transforming Croatia's Rijeka port and city

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            transforming Croatia's Rijeka port and city. Rijeka is
            one of the largest private terminal operators in the world.
            The long term plan was to make the port, a gateway to
            Central Europe and competitive to container and other
            maritime traffic, making the city more livable for its
            citizens and more attractive to tourists. Rijeka Gateway
            Project upgraded the Brajdica terminal, big enough for
            cruise ships with 500 passengers to dock, allowing easy
            passage from sea to land

13364974.majtheme: Social protection and risk management,Trade and integration,Financial and private sector development,Public sector governance

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objective of the Rijeka
            Gateway Project is to increase Croatia's trade
            competitiveness by improving the international transport
            chain through the Rijeka gateway for both freight and
            passengers traffic through modernizing the port and road
            network connections, and privatizing port operations. The
            reallocation will ensure the full disbursement of the loan
            and reflects the need for additional funds for civil works
            and fewer funds for goods over the period. The extension is
            necessary due to initial delays in the mobilization of the
            contractor for the Brajdica container terminal. The precise
            status of all ongoing contracts was reviewed during a recent
            implementation support mission in October 2010. This review
            confirmed that all funds under this loan are expected to be
            disbursed by the new closing date for this loan. This will
            be the second extension of closing date for this loan.

display_title.display_title:
Croatia - Rijeka Gateway Project
            : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
